Key Match Events: Wales were reduced to 10 in the final seconds as Chris Mepham was banished for a second yellow card
Ben Davies had a first-half header disallowed for offside
Kieffer Moore was a consistent threat in the air and was denied a couple of times from the goalkeeping heroics of Wojciech Szczesny
Pre-Game Insights: Wales manager Rob Page said 'there's nerves' ahead of Euro 2024 qualifier against Poland
Wales ‘prepared for tough challenge’ of Euro 2024 play-off final against Poland, says Rob Page
Post-Match Reflections: Wales manager Rob Page said 'it's a cruel game, that's what I've said to the players, one kick away from qualifying. It hurts.'
Wales captain Ben Davies said 'it's a difficult one to take, we put everything into the game but in the end it wasn’t to be.'
Former Wales midfielder Joe Allen said 'on Dan James he’s been a crucial player for Wales over the recent years.'
Former Wales midfielder Joe Allen said'such a cruel way to end a game, so sad for Dan James.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Wales’ first-ever penalty shootout
Wales are a team in transition after the loss of Gareth Bale due to retirement
The future is a bright one for Wales, after this summer focus will turn to the World Cup campaign.
Others: The Polish players start the celebrations. The Welsh players are heartbroken. Dan James looks gutted.
Poland are heading to Euro 2024. Wales miss out on another major tournament appearance.
